segment.source: Prepare for deployment with MDT 2013 Update 2 (Windows 10)
segment.target: Prepare for deployment with MDT 2013 Update 2 (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic will walk you through the steps necessary to create the server structure required to deploy the Windows 10 operating system using the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) 2013 Update 2.
segment.target: This topic will walk you through the steps necessary to create the server structure required to deploy the Windows 10 operating system using the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) 2013 Update 2.

segment.source: Prepare for deployment with MDT 2013 Update 2
segment.target: Prepare for deployment with MDT 2013 Update 2

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic will walk you through the steps necessary to create the server structure required to deploy the Windows 10 operating system using the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) 2013 Update 2.
segment.target: This topic will walk you through the steps necessary to create the server structure required to deploy the Windows 10 operating system using the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) 2013 Update 2.

segment.source: It covers the installation of the necessary system prerequisites, the creation of shared folders and service accounts, and the configuration of security permissions in the files system and in Active Directory.
segment.target: It covers the installation of the necessary system prerequisites, the creation of shared folders and service accounts, and the configuration of security permissions in the files system and in Active Directory.

segment.source: For the purposes of this topic, we will use two machines: DC01 and MDT01.
segment.target: For the purposes of this topic, we will use two machines: DC01 and MDT01.

segment.source: DC01 is a domain controller and MDT01 is a Windows Server 2012 R2 standard server.
segment.target: DC01 is a domain controller and MDT01 is a Windows Server 2012 R2 standard server.

segment.source: MDT01 is a member of the domain contoso.com for the fictitious Contoso Corporation.
segment.target: MDT01 is a member of the domain contoso.com for the fictitious Contoso Corporation.

segment.source: For more details on the setup for this topic, please see Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.
segment.target: For more details on the setup for this topic, please see Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.

segment.source: System requirements
segment.target: System requirements

segment.source: MDT 2013 Update 2 requires the following components:
segment.target: MDT 2013 Update 2 requires the following components:

segment.source: Any of the following operating systems:
segment.target: Any of the following operating systems:

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2012 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2012 R2

segment.source: Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK) for Windows 10
segment.target: Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK) for Windows 10

segment.source: Windows PowerShell
segment.target: Windows PowerShell

segment.source: Microsoft .NET Framework
segment.target: Microsoft .NET Framework

segment.source: Install Windows ADK for Windows 10
segment.target: Install Windows ADK for Windows 10

segment.source: These steps assume that you have the MDT01 member server installed and configured and that you have downloaded Windows ADK for Windows 10 to the E:DownloadsADK folder.
segment.target: These steps assume that you have the MDT01 member server installed and configured and that you have downloaded Windows ADK for Windows 10 to the E:DownloadsADK folder.

segment.source: On MDT01, log on as Administrator in the CONTOSO domain using a password of P@ssw0rd.
segment.target: On MDT01, log on as Administrator in the CONTOSO domain using a password of P@ssw0rd.

segment.source: Start the ADK Setup (E:DownloadsADKadksetup.exe), and on the first wizard page, click Continue.
segment.target: Start the ADK Setup (E:DownloadsADKadksetup.exe), and on the first wizard page, click Continue.

segment.source: On the Select the features you want to change page, select the features below and complete the wizard using the default settings:
segment.target: On the Select the features you want to change page, select the features below and complete the wizard using the default settings:

segment.source: Deployment Tools
segment.target: Deployment Tools

segment.source: Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE)
segment.target: Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE)

segment.source: User State Migration Tool (UMST)
segment.target: User State Migration Tool (UMST)

segment.source: Install MDT 2013 Update 2
segment.target: Install MDT 2013 Update 2

segment.source: These steps assume that you have downloaded MDT 2013 Update 2 to the E:DownloadsMDT 2013 folder on MDT01.
segment.target: These steps assume that you have downloaded MDT 2013 Update 2 to the E:DownloadsMDT 2013 folder on MDT01.

segment.source: On MDT01, log on as Administrator in the CONTOSO domain using a password of P@ssw0rd.
segment.target: On MDT01, log on as Administrator in the CONTOSO domain using a password of P@ssw0rd.

segment.source: Install MDT (E:DownloadsMDT 2013MicrosoftDeploymentToolkit2013x64.msi) with the default settings.
segment.target: Install MDT (E:DownloadsMDT 2013MicrosoftDeploymentToolkit2013x64.msi) with the default settings.

segment.source: Create the OU structure
segment.target: Create the OU structure

segment.source: If you do not have an organizational unit (OU) structure in your Active Directory, you should create one.
segment.target: If you do not have an organizational unit (OU) structure in your Active Directory, you should create one.

segment.source: In this section, you create an OU structure and a service account for MDT 2013 Update 2.
segment.target: In this section, you create an OU structure and a service account for MDT 2013 Update 2.

segment.source: On DC01, using Active Directory User and Computers, in the contoso.com domain level, create a top-level OU named Contoso.
segment.target: On DC01, using Active Directory User and Computers, in the contoso.com domain level, create a top-level OU named Contoso.

segment.source: In the Contoso OU, create the following OUs:
segment.target: In the Contoso OU, create the following OUs:

segment.source: Accounts
segment.target: Accounts

segment.source: Computers
segment.target: Computers

segment.source: Groups
segment.target: Groups

segment.source: In the Contoso / Accounts OU, create the following underlying OUs:
segment.target: In the Contoso / Accounts OU, create the following underlying OUs:

segment.source: Admins
segment.target: Admins

segment.source: Service Accounts
segment.target: Service Accounts

segment.source: Users
segment.target: Users

segment.source: In the Contoso / Computers OU, create the following underlying OUs:
segment.target: In the Contoso / Computers OU, create the following underlying OUs:

segment.source: Servers
segment.target: Servers

segment.source: Workstations
segment.target: Workstations

segment.source: In the Contoso / Groups OU, create the following OU:
segment.target: In the Contoso / Groups OU, create the following OU:

segment.source: Security Groups
segment.target: Security Groups

segment.source: figure 6
segment.target: figure 6

segment.source: Figure 6.
segment.target: Figure 6.

segment.source: A sample of how the OU structure will look after all the OUs are created.
segment.target: A sample of how the OU structure will look after all the OUs are created.

segment.source: Create the MDT service account
segment.target: Create the MDT service account

segment.source: When creating a reference image, you need an account for MDT.
segment.target: When creating a reference image, you need an account for MDT.

segment.source: The MDT Build Account is used for Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE) to connect to MDT01.
segment.target: The MDT Build Account is used for Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE) to connect to MDT01.

segment.source: On DC01, using Active Directory User and Computers, browse to contoso.com / Contoso / Service Accounts.
segment.target: On DC01, using Active Directory User and Computers, browse to contoso.com / Contoso / Service Accounts.

segment.source: Select the Service Accounts OU and create the MDTBA account using the following settings:
segment.target: Select the Service Accounts OU and create the MDTBA account using the following settings:

segment.source: Name: MDTBA
segment.target: Name: MDTBA

segment.source: User logon name: MDTBA
segment.target: User logon name: MDTBA

segment.source: Password: P@ssw0rd
segment.target: Password: P@ssw0rd

segment.source: User must change password at next logon: Clear
segment.target: User must change password at next logon: Clear

segment.source: User cannot change password: Selected
segment.target: User cannot change password: Selected

segment.source: Password never expires: Selected
segment.target: Password never expires: Selected

segment.source: Create and share the logs folder
segment.target: Create and share the logs folder

segment.source: By default MDT stores the log files locally on the client.
segment.target: By default MDT stores the log files locally on the client.

segment.source: In order to capture a reference image, you will need to enable server-side logging and, to do that, you will need to have a folder in which to store the logs.
segment.target: In order to capture a reference image, you will need to enable server-side logging and, to do that, you will need to have a folder in which to store the logs.

segment.source: For more information, see Create a Windows 10 reference image.
segment.target: For more information, see Create a Windows 10 reference image.

segment.source: On MDT01, log on as CONTOSOAdministrator.
segment.target: On MDT01, log on as CONTOSOAdministrator.

segment.source: Create and share the E:Logs folder by running the following commands in an elevated Windows PowerShell prompt:
segment.target: Create and share the E:Logs folder by running the following commands in an elevated Windows PowerShell prompt:

segment.source: figure 7
segment.target: figure 7

segment.source: Figure 7.
segment.target: Figure 7.

segment.source: The Sharing tab of the E:Logs folder after sharing it with PowerShell.
segment.target: The Sharing tab of the E:Logs folder after sharing it with PowerShell.

segment.source: Use CMTrace to read log files (optional)
segment.target: Use CMTrace to read log files (optional)

segment.source: The log files in MDT Lite Touch are formatted to be read by Configuration Manager Trace (CMTrace), which is available as part of Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager Toolkit.
segment.target: The log files in MDT Lite Touch are formatted to be read by Configuration Manager Trace (CMTrace), which is available as part of Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager Toolkit.

segment.source: You can use Notepad, but CMTrace formatting makes the logs easier to read.
segment.target: You can use Notepad, but CMTrace formatting makes the logs easier to read.

segment.source: figure 8
segment.target: figure 8

segment.source: Figure 8.
segment.target: Figure 8.

segment.source: An MDT log file opened in Notepad.
segment.target: An MDT log file opened in Notepad.

segment.source: figure 9
segment.target: figure 9

segment.source: Figure 9.
segment.target: Figure 9.

segment.source: The same log file, opened in CMTrace, is much easier to read.
segment.target: The same log file, opened in CMTrace, is much easier to read.
